SEARCH
Package com.example.restful.api.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.example.restful.api.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/users") public class UserController extends Object
Controller class that handles RESTful API operations for User entities.

This class provides endpoints to perform CRUD operations on users, including retrieving user details, registering new users, updating existing users, and marking users as deleted.

Base URL: /api/users

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mizan

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsers

      @GetMapping public List<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves a list of all registered users.
      Returns:
      a list of User objects representing all users.

    • getUserById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> getUserById(@PathVariable Long id)
      Retrieves a specific user by their unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the User if found, or an empty response with HTTP 404 status if not found.

    • getUserByUsername

      @GetMapping("/username/{username}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> getUserByUsername(@PathVariable String username)
      Retrieves a specific user by their username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the User if found, or an empty response with HTTP 404 status if not found.

    • registerUser

      @PostMapping(consumes="application/json", produces="application/json") public com.example.restful.api.model.WebResponse<String> registerUser(@RequestBody com.example.restful.api.model.RegisterUserRequest request)
      Registers a new user in the system.
      Parameters:
      request - the request body containing user registration details.
      Returns:
      a WebResponse object indicating that the user has been successfully created.

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> updateUser(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody com.example.restful.api.entity.User userDetails)
      Updates an existing user's information based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to update.
      userDetails - the updated user details.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated User.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user does not exist.

    • deleteUser

      @PutMapping("/delete/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> deleteUser(@PathVariable Long id)
      Marks a user as deleted or removes the user record.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to delete.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the deleted User data.
